channel.title: Posts on Brahim Hamdouni · ابراهيم
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Brahim Hamdouni · ابراهيم

item.title: Udev Webcam
item.description: You can change the device link so your webcam will be always accessible at the same location /dev/video99. You can also persist some settings via the v4l-ctl command.

item.title: Console Font Size
item.description: This days, with 4K monitors, the linux console is unreadable : the font is too small. So how can we scale the font size in the console after boot ?

item.title: Git Rebase From Upstream
item.description: This note explains how to apply new commits in your forked repo from the parent (upstream) repo. If not already done, add a “remote” to the parent’s repo like this :

item.title: Big clock in a terminal
item.description: This note explains how to show a big clock on Linux without using an application or having a browser opened on time.

item.title: Change local ownCloud sync directory
item.description: To change the name of ownCloud main folder, there is a little trick you can do on Linux (may work as well on other platforms).

item.title: Local git
item.description: Define a repo somewhere in your file system with a bare init mkdir -p /somewhere/repo/test_project cd /somewhere/repo/test_project git init --bare Now create a local folder for your work with init only

item.title: Mysql prompt tip
item.description: You can change the mysql prompt client so you know where you are. Very usefull when you manage a lot of mysql databases and you forget which one :-)

item.title: Disable tabs in Firefox
item.description: If you use a tiled window manager like me, Suckless DWM for example, and have Firefox as your browser, you may be interested by not showing the tabs.

item.title: Make your ubuntu LTS kernel up to date
item.description: Install LTS Hardware Enablement Stack sudo apt-get install --install-recommends linux-generic-hwe-18.04 xserver-xorg-hwe-18.04 Clean sudo apt purge --autoremove Reboot to load new kernel

item.title: Install iso on USB key using #Linux console only
item.description: How to flash any iso (think about your favorite distro) on an USB key without graphical IHM ? sudo dd if=/path/to/image.

item.title: Force #wifi interface name on #Ubuntu 18.04
item.description: Using Udev, you can change the wifi interface name. First, you need to get the mac address. $ ip link 1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 65536 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN mode DEFAULT group default qlen 1000 link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00 2: **wlp1s0**: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP mode DORMANT group default qlen 1000 link/ether **9c:b6:d0:8a:71:11** brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff My wifi interface is name wlp1s0 and its mac address is just after the keyword “link/ether” : 9c:b6:d0:8a:71:11.

item.title: VS Code loses Go autocompletion on Linux
item.description: On my Linux, just after upgrading Go to version 1.9, I lost autompletion functionality in VS Code. :vscode_completion_not_working This tip did not work for me.

item.title: #Docker from scratch, #Golang and Multipart upload
item.description: To reduce docker container size we can built the image from scratch instead of using bloated images, like debian or worse ubuntu.

item.title: Samba public share
item.description: How to configure a Debian based Linux distribution to share a folder with anyone on the network, with read and write access ?

item.title: Convert PDF to PNG with enough resolution
item.description: As ‘man convert’ states : The convert program is a member of the ImageMagick suite of tools. Use it to convert between image formats as well as resize an image, blur, crop, despeckle, dither, draw on, flip, join, re-sample, and much more.

item.title: Don't forget master infos in your MySQL dump
item.description: I tried to resync a slave MySQL after it disconnected from the master. But the binary log was already deleted on master, so the only solution was to restore from the last backup.

item.title: Eve-style clock demo in Red, livecoded!
item.description: Demo Red is a next-gen programming language, strongly inspired by REBOL. Main features are: Homoiconic (Red is its own meta-language and own ** data-format **) Functional, imperative, ** reactive ** and symbolic programming Prototype-based object support **Gradual and multi-**typing ** Macros ** system Rich set of built-in datatypes (50+) Both statically and JIT- compiled to native code Cross-compilation right .

item.title: Consul 0.7.1 | HashiCorp
item.description: Consul is a critical infrastructure service for organizations that rely on it for service discovery, key/value storage, and health checks.

item.title: Docker - Build, Ship, and Run Any App, Anywhere
item.description: Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications, whether on laptops, data center VMs, or the cloud.

item.title: MySQL import from csv
item.description: To import a local CSV file into MySQL, use the syntax below : LOAD DATA LOW_PRIORITY LOCAL INFILE '/path/tofile.csv' INTO TABLE database.

item.title: MySQL export to csv
item.description: To export a mysql results in CSV format, use the syntax below : SELECT field1, field2, ... FROM table WHERE condition INTO OUTFILE '/tmp/toto.

item.title: Cheyenne server and POST size limit
item.description: By default, in Cheyenne, the header size limit for a post request is 102'400. If you want to ajust this limit you can define the post-mem-limit parameter in the global context or in a specific webapp.

item.title: Boot Linux in text console
item.description: Get rid of graphic boot on Linux with a few modifications in grub configuration : # edit your grub config sudo vi /etc/default/grub # remove splash, quiet, .

item.title: French Git Log
item.description: Git log in colors. git log --pretty='format:%Cblue%h%Creset %ad %Cred%<(8,trunc)%an%Creset%Cgreen%d%Creset %s' --date=short Shows how to use pretty format in Git with colors and fixed with columns (trunc) :

item.title: mysql client : don't show columns names and grid
item.description: Default mysql client behaviour is to show column names and grid when returning results but how to get rid of this decorations ?

item.title: Allow invalid date in MySQL
item.description: Just in case you absolutely have to insert a date in MySQL that does’nt exist, eg 2014-02-30, you can run MySQL server in a special mode that authorizes such dates :

item.title: screencast with byzance on linux
item.description: byzanz-record -c - duration=60 - x=80 - y=310 - width=800 - height=600 out.gif

item.title: Not permitted to mount disk ?
item.description: A few days ago, I started to have a very disturbing “Not permitted” message when trying to mount a usb disk from Thunar .

item.title: How To Forward Outlook Emails With VB Script
item.description: In Windows, create a certificate via Start > All Programs > Microsoft Office > Microsoft Office Tools > Digital Certificate for VBA Projects In Microsoft Outlook, open the VB editor and copy/paste the code below Replace your@email.

item.title: Invisible code sticks forever
item.description: A few months ago, I read an article about brain training by learning a new language : very interesting story about William Alexander who failed to learn french but strenghten his brain trying to.

item.title: Tmux for the impatient
item.description: tmux Create a new session (the first time) tmux a Attach to an existing session Ctrl+b d Detach Ctrl+b PgUp/PgDown Scroll (quit with q) also can use mouse after first page up or down (see tips below to activate normal mouse scrolling) Ctrl+b [ Copy mode (quit with q) Ctrl+b " Split horizontally Ctrl+b % Split vertically Ctrl+b arrow key Switch pane Hold Ctrl+b + arrow keys Resize pane Ctrl+b + z Toggle zoom in pane Tips Copy/pasting sudo apt-get install xclip Install xclip so buffer copied inside tmux are also available to X Shift + mouse selection Select text to copy Ctrl + Shift + C Copy Ctrl + Shift + V Paste Use the mouse for scrolling set -g mouse on put this command in ~/.

item.title: Wireless auto configuration with guessnet on Linux
item.description: Assume we have access to the wifi at work and at home. How can I configure my laptop to automatically connect to the right network without using a graphical network manager ?

item.title: If ssh client disconnect and freeze
item.description: Add in your ~/.ssh/config : Host * ServerAliveInterval 240 src = superuser.com

item.title: Git delete remote branch/tag
item.description: As of Git v1.7.0, you can delete a remote branch using : git push origin --delete <branchName> And you can do exactly the same with a tag

item.title: Horizontal rule in zsh prompt
item.description: Put in your ~/.zshrc : PS1=$'%U${(r:$COLUMNS:: :)}%u'$PS1 _src = superuser.com _

item.title: Increase wordpress max file upload size
item.description: On Ubuntu/Debian distro, edit the /etc/wordpress/htaccess and add this lines : php_value upload_max_filesize 50M php_value post_max_size 50M php_value memory_limit 50M

item.title: Substitute a text only in files where it appears
item.description: For example, to substitute foo with bar for f in `grep -lR foo`; do echo -n ">> $f"; sed 's/foo/bar/g' $f > $f.

item.title: Convert multiple files to utf8 using vim
item.description: The fastest and more efficient way to batch multiple files encoding conversion : vim +"argdo se fileencoding=utf-8 | w | bnext" +"q" ` find .

item.title: GIT - stop tracking files
item.description: If you have some files that you need to have in your repo but don’t need to have updates, git allows it :

item.title: ZSH, nohup and background process that lasts...
item.description: When I switched to ZSH, and let BASH behind, I missed some behaviour : one of them was the ability to quit my terminal while some jobs are still alive.

item.title: Install minimum php (no apache)
item.description: To code with php, no need to install apache and other dependencies, especially as php has a builtin web server.

item.title: Get rid of the Desktop icon in Nautilus 3.10 side bar
item.description: Add in ~/.config/gtk-3.0/settings.ini gtk-shell-shows-desktop=0 Remove all entries in ~/.config/user-dirs.dirs but let this one : XDG_DESKTOP_DIR="$HOME/" If you remove this too, each time nautilus is launched, it will create a ~/Desktop folder.

item.title: Stretched background with IE8
item.description: Side note : Microsoft has dropped support for IE8 last april 2014 :-( There are still some clients that want their webapp to work perfectly on IE8.

item.title: Speech Tasks : a voice driven todo webapp
item.description: With the Go http server. (By the way, I love opensource community !) Try the demo ! See the code !

item.title: usb mount and policykit
item.description: DWM is my tiled window manager. It’s fast, flexible and fun. My linux desktop is up and running after a few seconds… (ok, thanks also to the ssd :-) ).

item.description: Forget large background image for your web site. Now, comes video time. So you want to put a nice video as background of your site but don’t know how to do ?

item.title: 2048 Gremlins
item.description: 2048 : a very famous game where you have to slide the numbered tiles to join same numbers, and cumulate them to obtain 2048 !
